parts.text:
```xml
<output>
<analysis>
<has-cmf>False. There is no CMF number present in the provided post.</has-cmf>
<refers-to-candidate>False. The post does not refer to any specific parliamentary candidate by name, surname, or any other clear identifier.  It discusses the taxation of Romanian gas companies, a general economic issue, not directly tied to any candidate's platform.</refers-to-candidate>
<addresses-the-wide-population>True. The post is a paid advertisement on Facebook, a public platform, and the content is presented as a news article, aiming for a broad audience. The reach estimate is ">1M", indicating a wide dissemination.</addresses-the-wide-population>
<electoral-objective>False. The primary objective of the post appears to be to inform the public about the taxation of Romanian gas companies and their challenges in the market. While economic issues can indirectly influence voters' choices, this post doesn't explicitly advocate for or against any candidate or party in the parliamentary elections.</electoral-objective>
<journalism>True. The post presents information in a style consistent with journalistic reporting. It cites a source (jurnalul.ro and profit.ro), attributes a quote to a named individual (Daniel Apostol), and provides a link to a longer article.  The content focuses on factual information and analysis, rather than persuasive rhetoric aimed at influencing votes.</journalism>
<personal_opinion>False. While the article expresses concerns about the tax regime, it does so in a manner consistent with presenting an argument based on factual information and analysis, not personal opinion intended to sway votes.</personal_opinion>
</analysis>

<conclusion>
<post_id>1012815314223652</post_id>
<electoral-propaganda-analysis>
The Facebook post, while discussing an economic issue relevant to Romania, does not constitute electoral propaganda under Article 98 t) of LEGE nr. 208 din 20 iulie 2015.  The post lacks direct references to any parliamentary candidates or parties, its objective is primarily informative rather than persuasive, and its style is consistent with journalistic reporting. The fact that it's a paid advertisement doesn't automatically qualify it as propaganda; the content itself must meet the criteria for electoral propaganda.  In this case, it does not.
</electoral-propaganda-analysis>
<electoral-propaganda-decision>FALSE</electoral-propaganda-decision>
<electoral-propaganda-candidates/>
<responsible-party-or-group>Photomedia EM360 SRL</responsible-party-or-group>
<message-for-police/>
</conclusion>
</output>
```
